author: Hilary Brueck and Shayanne Gal
title: How the coronavirus death toll compares to other pandemics, including SARS, HIV, and the Black Death
description: The new coronavirus, and the illness it causes, COVID-19, have killed more than 44,000 people around the world so far. The viral illness is extremely contagious, and spreads from person to person easily through close contact. The most severe coronavirus cases…
content:
The novel coronavirus has already killed more than 3,000 people in China, 9,000 in Spain, 12,000 in Italy, and it isn't done yet.
In the US, the White House's Coronavirus Task Force has recently estimated that in a best case scenario, the virus may kill upwa… [+561 chars]
